summary: Clifford A Fenton, Jr. was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). The documents provided are payroll certifications and a certification report that list Fenton's name, position, salary, and earnings during various periods from 1977 to 1978. These documents confirm Fenton's employment with the HSCA during its investigation into the JFK assassination. The specific role or responsibilities of Fenton within the HSCA are not detailed in these documents, but his presence on the payroll indicates his involvement in the committee's operations.
key_connections: U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA)
significance: Clifford A Fenton, Jr. was an employee of the HSCA, contributing to the investigation into the JFK assassination, although the specific nature and impact of his contribution are not detailed in the provided documents.
